column4: it seems that i have sound modules loaded but i have no sound at all? anyone using the ATI Technologies Inc IXP150 AC'97 Audio Controller for sound?
warty?
yes
you need a newer version of ALSA.
what's the best way to go about that?
sudo aptitude install build-essential kernel-package linux-headers-$(uname -r)
then: wget http://ftp.wa.au.debian.org/debian/pool/main/a/alsa-driver/alsa-source_1.0.8-4_all.deb
then: sudo dpkg -i alsa-source_1.0.8-4_all.deb
then: sudo dpkg-reconfigure alsa-source
then please read the documentation at /usr/share/doc/alsa-source/README.Debian
ok cool - after all that is a reboot needed?
no, a removal of the current ALSA modules and a reinsertion of the newly-compiled and -installed ALSA modules
a reboot will be simpler, but it's not required.
i did all that it said within that file but i get a dependency errors
which dependency is missing?
it's in #flood
ok, you'll need more dependencies because alsa-driver has been updated to require additional 1.0.8 versions.
/j #alsa
you around mate?
aye
sudo aptitude remowe foo
that MARK in /var/log/messages - i can't find anything in man syslog.conf or /etc/syslog.conf about taking that out?
